text: Richard Lewis "Dick" Thornburgh (July 16, 1932 - December 31, 2020) was an American lawyer and Republican politician. He served as the 41st Governor of Pennsylvania from 1979 to 1987, and then as the U.S. Attorney General from 1988 to 1991. Thornburg resigned as Attorney General to run for the United States Senate in Pennsylvania in 1991, but lost to Democratic Harris Wofford. Thornburgh died on December 31, 2020 in Verona, Pennsylvania at the age of 88. ==References== ==Other websites== *The Dick Thornburgh Papers at the University of Pittsburgh. * The Dick Thornburgh Forum for Law and Public Policy *Finding Aid for the Jay C.
